matpr = function(A){
  pra = "\\begin{bmatrix}\n"
  for(i in 1:dim(A)[1]){
    pra = paste0(pra,paste0(A[i,],collapse=" & "))
    if(i<dim(A)[1]){pra = paste0(pra,"\\\\\n")} else {pra = paste0(pra,"\n")}
  }
  pra = paste0(pra,"\\end{bmatrix}")
  return(pra)
}
matcc = function(A){
  s = "[["
  for(i in 1:(dim(A)[1])){
    s2 = paste0(A[i,],collapse=",")
    s = paste0(s,s2,collapse="")
    if(i<dim(A)[1]){
      s = paste0(s,"],[",collapse="")
    }
  }
  s = paste0(s,"]]",collapse="")
  return(s)
}

Question
========

Consider the orthographic projection matrix below to project 3D points into a 2D plane:

$$P = \begin{bmatrix}1 & 0.1 & 0 \\ 0 & 0.1 & 1\end{bmatrix}$$

Also consider the [3D rotation matrices](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rotation_matrix#In_three_dimensions) around the $x$, $y$, and $z$ axes.

$$R_x = \begin{bmatrix}1 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & \cos(\theta) & -\sin(\theta) \\ 0 &\sin(\theta) & \cos(\theta) \end{bmatrix}$$

$$R_y = \begin{bmatrix}\cos(\theta) & 0 & \sin(\theta) \\ 0 & 1 & 0 \\ -\sin(\theta) & 0 & \cos(\theta) \end{bmatrix}$$

$$R_z = \begin{bmatrix}\cos(\theta) & -\sin(\theta) & 0 \\ \sin(\theta) & \cos(\theta) & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 1\end{bmatrix}$$

We will take a set of points, rotate them around the $x$ axis and $y$ axis. Then, we will animate the points as they rotate around the $z$ axis.

X = matrix(`r matcc(X)`)
